alert.note: Alert for Dodge (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 12 at 7:08PM CDT until May 12 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN BURT...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND CENTRAL DODGE COUNTIES... At 708 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Uehling to 4 miles north of Hooper to 6 miles northwest of Fremont, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fremont, Oakland, Hooper, Nickerson, Uehling, Craig, Winslow, Summit Lake State Recreation Area, Fremont Lakes State Recreation Area and Ames. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern and east central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
